location: A room in the Garter Inn.

lines.text: Enter FALSTAFF, Host, BARDOLPH, NYM, PISTOL, and ROBIN

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Mine host of the Garter!

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: What says my bullyrook speak scholarly and wisely.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Truly, mine host, I must turn away some of my followers.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Discard, bully Hercules cashier: let them wag trot, trot.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: I sit at ten pounds a week.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Thourt an emperor, Caesar, Keisar, and Pheezar. I will entertain Bardolph he shall draw, he shall tap: said I well, bully Hector

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Do so, good mine host.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: I have spoke let him follow. Let me see thee froth and lime: I am at a word follow.
To BARDOLPH
Exit

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Bardolph, follow him. A tapster is a good trade: an old cloak makes a new jerkin a withered servingman a fresh tapster. Go adieu.

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: It is a life that I have desired: I will thrive.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: O base Hungarian wight! wilt thou the spigot wield
Exit BARDOLPH

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: He was gotten in drink: is not the humour conceited

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: I am glad I am so acquit of this tinderbox: his thefts were too open his filching was like an unskilful singer he kept not time.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: The good humour is to steal at a minutes rest.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Convey, the wise it call. Steal! foh! a fico for the phrase!

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Well, sirs, I am almost out at heels.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Why, then, let kibes ensue.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: There is no remedy I must conycatch I must shift.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Young ravens must have food.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Which of you know Ford of this town

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: I ken the wight: he is of substance good.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: My honest lads, I will tell you what I am about.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Two yards, and more.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: No quips now, Pistol! Indeed, I am in the waist two yards about but I am now about no waste I am about thrift. Briefly, I do mean to make love to Fords wife: I spy entertainment in her she discourses, she carves, she gives the leer of invitation: I can construe the action of her familiar style and the hardest voice of her behavior, to be Englished rightly, is, I am Sir John Falstaffs.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: He hath studied her will, and translated her will, out of honesty into English.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: The anchor is deep: will that humour pass

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: Now, the report goes she has all the rule of her husbands purse: he hath a legion of angels.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: As many devils entertain and To her, boy, say I.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: The humour rises it is good: humour me the angels.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: I have writ me here a letter to her: and here another to Pages wife, who even now gave me good eyes too, examined my parts with most judicious oeillades sometimes the beam of her view gilded my foot, sometimes my portly belly.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Then did the sun on dunghill shine.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: I thank thee for that humour.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: O, she did so course oer my exteriors with such a greedy intention, that the appetite of her eye did seem to scorch me up like a burningglass! Heres another letter to her: she bears the purse too she is a region in Guiana, all gold and bounty. I will be cheater to them both, and they shall be exchequers to me they shall be my East and West Indies, and I will trade to them both. Go bear thou this letter to Mistress Page and thou this to Mistress Ford: we will thrive, lads, we will thrive.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Shall I Sir Pandarus of Troy become, And by my side wear steel then, Lucifer take all!

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: I will run no base humour: here, take the humourletter: I will keep the havior of reputation.

lines.speaker: falstaff
lines.text: [To ROBIN]  Hold, sirrah, bear you these letters tightly Sail like my pinnace to these golden shores. Rogues, hence, avaunt! vanish like hailstones, go Trudge, plod away o the hoof seek shelter, pack! Falstaff will learn the humour of the age, French thrift, you rogues myself and skirted page.
Exeunt FALSTAFF and ROBIN

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Let vultures gripe thy guts! for gourd and fullam holds, And high and low beguiles the rich and poor: Tester Ill have in pouch when thou shalt lack, Base Phrygian Turk!

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: I have operations which be humours of revenge.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Wilt thou revenge

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: By welkin and her star!

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: With wit or steel

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: With both the humours, I: I will discuss the humour of this love to Page.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: And I to Ford shall eke unfold How Falstaff, varlet vile, His dove will prove, his gold will hold, And his soft couch defile.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: My humour shall not cool: I will incense Page to deal with poison I will possess him with yellowness, for the revolt of mine is dangerous: that is my true humour.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Thou art the Mars of malecontents: I second thee troop on.
Exeunt
